perturbation.original_text: "Chrome Use Event" means an event that indicates an [* ] has occurred.     "Chrome Server Communication" means a communication that, as determined solely by Google, is sent for the purpose of indicating that an End  User: (a) is [* ] to the [* ]; and (b) has kept the [* ] open for a minimum of [* ] during a [* ] (whether during the [* ] or a [* ] of the Chrome  Browser).
perturbation.changed_text: "Chrome Use Event" means an event that indicates user interaction.     "Chrome Server Communication" means a communication that, as determined solely by Google, is sent for the purpose of indicating that an End  User has interacted with the Chrome Browser.
perturbation.explanation: The original definitions of "Chrome Use Event" and "Chrome Server Communication" contained bracketed asterisks, indicating confidential information was omitted. By replacing these with vague and undefined terms, the agreement loses clarity and creates uncertainty around what exactly constitutes a 'Chrome Use Event' or qualifies for 'Chrome Server Communication'. The original terms reference specific criteria now missing, making enforcement and measurement difficult.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Payments. Subject to Clause 4.2, during the Term on a [ * ] basis, Google shall pay to Distributor the applicable payment set out in Exhibit  A for each [ * ] and each [ * ] that occurred during the previous [ * ]. Google shall determine the [ * ] in respect of which each [ * ] and  [ * ] took [ * ] (using the relevant [ * ]). Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event will the [ * ] of [ * ] by Google to Distributor for all  [ * ] and all [ * ] in respect of [ * ] (as set out in Exhibit A) exceed [ * ] ([ * ]) of the [ * ] to Distributor for such [ * ].
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 Payments. Subject to Clause 4.2, during the Term, Google shall pay to Distributor an amount as described in Exhibit A. Google shall determine payments based on user engagement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, payments by Google to Distributor are capped.
perturbation.explanation: The original section on 'Payments' refers to confidential information regarding payment frequency, calculation specifics (each [ * ] and each [ * ]) and measurement of activity. By removing these specifics and replacing them with generalized statements like 'an amount as described in Exhibit A' and 'payments based on user engagement', the contract becomes ambiguous. Exhibit A is still referenced, but without context the reference is unclear, contradicting the intention of clear payment terms.

perturbation.original_text:
8.2 Google warrants that the Distribution Products will for a period of [ * ] from the date of their supply to Distributor be free from any defect  which has a materially adverse effect on their use or operation.

8.3 If any of the warranties in Clause 8.1 or 8.2 is breached by Google, Distributor must tell Google as soon as possible. Distributor must give  Google a reasonable time to fix the problem and (if necessary) to supply Distributor with a corrected or replacement version of the  Distribution Product or a way to work-around the problem that is not materially detrimental to Distributor, or to re-perform any relevant  services. This will be done without any additional charge to Distributor. If Google is able to do this within a reasonable time, Google will  have no other obligations or liability in relation to that breach.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.2 Google warrants that the Distribution Products will be free from any defect which has a materially adverse effect on their use or operation.

8.3 If any of the warranties in Clause 8.1 or 8.2 is breached by Google, Distributor must inform Google. Distributor must allow Google reasonable opportunity to resolve the problem. If Google resolves the problem within a reasonable time, Google will have no other obligations or liability in relation to that breach.
perturbation.explanation: Clause 8.2 originally included a warranty period of '[ * ]' which is now removed. By omitting the specific warranty period, the amended clause creates ambiguity regarding how long Google is liable for defects. Clause 8.3 is modified to remove Google's responsibility to 'supply Distributor with a corrected or replacement version of the Distribution Product' and remove requirement to 'not materially detrimental to Distributor'. The changed clause 8.3 is creating contradiction between responsibility of Google to fix the problem with no replacement. The clause weakens distributors position to be able to sell fully functioning product to the market.
